title: Two Injured in Dracut Incidents
maintext:
DRACUT -- Police are investigating an incident on Sesame Street after two people were transported to hospitals -- one with life-threatening injuries -- early Tuesday morning, according to the Middlesex District Attorney’s Office.
Police responded to a 911 call at a Sesame Street residence shortly after midnight. Upon arrival, police located a woman with life-threatening injuries. She was transported to a Boston hospital.
Then, police responded to a serious car crash at the intersection of Methuen Street and Parker Road. The man behind the wheel may have been driving from the Sesame Street location, according to police. He suffered serious injuries, and was transported to an area hospital.
“There is no present threat to public safety,” reads a statement from the Middlesex District Attorney’s Office.
The incident is under investigation.
